thread.title: 'Refugees Welcome' banner draped on Lady Liberty
thread.title_full: 'Refugees Welcome' banner draped on Lady Liberty

author: cnbc.com
title: 'Refugees Welcome' banner draped on Lady Liberty
text:
Activist scaled the Statue of Liberty and unfurled a red and white "Refugees Welcome" banner on Tuesday, just hours after the Department of Homeland Security unveiled its sweeping plan to deport undocumented immigrants across the U.S.
The banner, which measured 3 feet by 20 feet in length, was unrolled and dangled from the statue's observation deck, the National Park Service said.
The sign was removed more than an hour later after it surfaced, the Associated Press reported, but not before images spread like wildfire on social media:
Tweet 1
Tweet 2
According to CNN, an activist group called Alt Lady Liberty claimed responsibility for the banner.
" Almost all Americans have descendants from somewhere else," the group told CNN. "Immigrants and refugees make this country great. And turning away refugees, like we did to Anne Frank, does not make us great."
More from USA Today:
Trump administration to change transgender student bathroom rules
Trump too late in denouncing anti-Semitic acts, critics say
IOC should have seen Rio wasteland coming
Alt Lady Liberty posted several images of the banner on its Twitter account, with one caption reading: "The message of the Statue of Liberty is unmistakable."
Tweet 3
Tweet 4
